intro: Strobilanthes marchandii, commonly known as the "Bornean flame flower," is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that bloom in vibrant orange or red hues. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its unique floral structure attracts specific pollinators, such as bees and birds, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
